msContents.summary: Letter from Lucius Bellenus Gemellus to Epagathus, perhaps his nephew. Gemellus sends instructions to Epagathus to perform certain tasks related to the running of his estate

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; on the verso, an address
35 lines; complete but for a large hole at the center left. Some holes along a vertical fold line
The address is written in large, formal letters. The text is in a semi-formal round hand of the literary type. The last 4 lines are written in a small cursive hand
Some abbreviations towards the end of the text

provenance.p: Given to Columbia University by the Egypt Exploration Society, 1901

keywords.term: Lucius Bellenus Gemellus -- landowner in the Fayum

div.ab: Lucius Bellenus Gemellus to his own Epagathos, greetings. When you receive my letter, please have the manure heaped up in order that you may make the store place which you mention, and dig a deep trench around the oilpress outside in order that access to the winepress may not be easy, and remove the manure to the manure pile, and let them flood all our fields in order that the sheep may be folded there, and let them irrigate the oliveyards for the second time, and go over to Dionysias and find out whether the oliveyard has been watered twice and dug; and if not, let it be watered . . . and give to . . . and Psellos, the sitologoi . . . and Chairas, the scribe of the cultivators, and to Heraklas ninety drachmas and interest, and to Chairas, the former tax collector, 24 drachmas, and Didas . . . the price of the barley, 240 drachmas and interest, and to Heron, the former president (?), two years
